definition: tiger stripes/tiger cub/(old) classifier for troops

sentences.english: He's worth three chapters in a textbook.
sentences.chinese: 他的功勳彪炳，值得在教科書裏大寫特寫。

sentences.english: It was a poem of centuries.
sentences.chinese: 它是一首能彪炳若干世紀的佳作。

sentences.english: I wish my teammates a million successes until I get back.
sentences.chinese: 衷心祝福隊友們在我歸來的時候取得彪炳的戰績。

sentences.english: This merit will shine throughout history and no one can obliterate it.
sentences.chinese: 這一功績彪炳史冊，是任何人也抹殺不了的。

sentences.english: Clear bags for Can Sugar allow the colour and texture of the sugar to shine through.
sentences.chinese: 清晰袋糖使糖的顏色和質地彪炳。

sentences.english: But they weren't young, dashing men.
sentences.chinese: 但是他們不年輕，卻是彪炳的男人。

sentences.english: Earlier presidents had made their mark by rising to historical occasions with ringing oratory.
sentences.chinese: 前任的總統都是靠着政治作秀而彪炳史冊。

definition: worthy of pride/impressive/enviable/to show contempt for others
achievement/meritorious deed/contributions (for the good of society)
to be brave and good at fighting (idiom)
to lead military operations with extraordinary skill
